meanings.definition: The fibrous residue left after sugarcane or sorghum stalks are crushed to extract their juice.
meanings.sent1: The bagasse from the sugarcane was used to make eco-friendly plates.
meanings.sent2: Farmers collect bagasse to recycle it into useful products.
meanings.sent3: The bagasse decided to take a break from being a leftover and became a star in a recycling plant.
meanings.sent4: The bagasse whispered stories of the sugarcane fields it came from.
meanings.sent5: Under the hot sun, the bagasse danced in the wind, a reminder of the sweet juice it once held.

meanings.definition: A material used for making paper, fuel, and other products.
meanings.sent1: The factory used bagasse to create sustainable packaging for their products.
meanings.sent2: Bagasse is a versatile material that can be turned into various useful items.
meanings.sent3: The bagasse chuckled as it transformed into a new paper bag, ready to carry groceries.
meanings.sent4: In the hands of skilled artisans, bagasse turned into beautiful works of art.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh paper filled the room as the bagasse pulp was pressed and dried.
